QNH.description: This is the air pressure setting used to calibrate an aircraft's altimeter, which shows its height above sea level. For example, if a pilot hears 'QNH 1013', they will set this value on their altimeter to get an accurate reading.
QNH.suffix: , descending 3000 feet, call you established 12 dme arc, {Call Sign}

Altitude.description: This is a command for the height an aircraft should fly at or descend to. For example, 'descending 4000ft' tells a pilot to lower their aircraft to that specific height.
Altitude.suffix: , call you established 12 dme arc, {Call Sign}

Departure Taxiway.description: This is the specific route an aircraft must follow on the ground to get to the runway for takeoff. For example, 'taxi via C-N-N2' instructs the pilot on the path to take.

Arrival Taxiway.description: This is the route an aircraft follows on the ground after landing to get to its gate or parking area. For example, 'taxi via S1' tells the pilot which path to take after leaving the runway.

Runway Vacate Taxiway.description: This is a command instructing a pilot on which taxiway to use to exit the runway after landing. For example, 'runway vacated via S1' is the confirmation a pilot gives after they have followed the instruction.

Parking Taxiway.description: This is the final ground route an aircraft follows to its designated parking spot or gate. For example, 'taxi via S1-S-C' is the final set of instructions a pilot receives to reach their parking spot.

TIME.description: This is the time, typically provided in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) format. For example, a pilot might receive 'TIME 1335' to be aware of a specific time-sensitive instruction.
